title: How the Internet Came to Loathe Pete Buttigieg
description: It’s natural for a rising candidate to get kicked around. But the nature of the backlash says a lot about the past decade of Democratic politics.
content: The front-runner of the month always gets kicked around, but what has been interesting about the criticism Buttigieg faces is the way it always seems to be about the totality of Mayor Pete, in all his best-and-brightest-ness how, in the absence of much of a r… [+1806 chars]

author: Amie Tsang
title: With Echoes of Trump, Boris Johnson Scorns the BBC
description: The prime minister and his party question the broadcaster’s reliance on fees paid by viewers. They are increasingly at odds with its journalism, too.
content:
But Claire Enders, the founder of the telecommunications and media research firm Enders Analysis, said Mr. Johnsons Trumpian manner toward the BBC and other broadcasters over their news coverage was without precedent.

author: Margaret Renkl
title: Burgers for a Better Planet
description: My 91-year-old father-in-law happily eats plant-based hamburgers. That gives me a little more hope for the environment.
content: Worse, the demand for meat keeps growing. Worldwide, it has nearly doubled in the past 30 years and is expected to double again by 2050. Already, the single greatest cause of deforestation in the Amazon is cattle ranching, accounting for 80 percent of newly l… [+2981 chars]
